thread.title: LIVE Pune Test, Day 3: Smith, Marsh stretch Australia's lead past 300
thread.title_full: LIVE Pune Test, Day 3: Smith, Marsh stretch Australia's lead past 300

title: LIVE Pune Test, Day 3: Smith, Marsh stretch Australia's lead past 300
text:
Cricket LIVE Pune Test, Day 3: Steve Smith, Mitchell Marsh stretch Australia's lead past 300 Australia already have a big score on the board and they will look to extend it further at a brisk rate. India, on the other hand, will obviously want to get them out early and have a go with the bat. IndiaToday.in | Posted by Subhasish Dutta A + A - BCCI Photo 
Hello and welcome to our Live coverage of the day three of the first Test between India and Australia. Stay tuned as we bring you all the latest updates. ( LIVE SCORECARD ) 
9.33 IST: NOT OUT! Floats it up around off, Smith looks to glide it towards backward point but gets it off the outer part of the bat. Steven wants to come back for second as Jayant Yadav fires in a throw at the striker's end. Saha collects the ball and whips the bails off as Smith dives to get back in. They appeal for a run out and it's taken upstairs. Replays show the Aussie skipper has made it in, a couple of runs taken. AUS 147/4, lead IND by 302 runs 
9.30 IST: All set to get things rolling. Steven Smith and Mitchell Marsh stride out to the middle with the intent of building up their lead even more. Ravichandran Ashwin will fire away with the ball first up. Here we go.. 
9.25 IST: Pitch Report: Shane Warne said the cracks were starting to open up. Meanwhile, Sunil Gavaskar added that it will make batting a bit more difficult. He said it was like a dust bowl and that the bowlers should bowl on a back of a length, more of where Josh Hazlewood frequently bowls. Warne ended by saying that today will be an excellent day of Test cricket and India will fightback hard for sure. 
9.15 IST: Here's Day 2 hero Steve O'Keefe in slow motion. Day two hero SOK in slo-mo #INDvAUS pic.twitter.com/FMkm0865NE â€” cricket.com.au (@CricketAus) February 25, 2017 
9.10 IST: Team India warms up before the start of the day's play. Shout of "Kohli" from a kid in the crowd and the captain obliges #TeamIndia #INDvAUS pic.twitter.com/myXCpBGLca â€” BCCI (@BCCI) February 25, 2017 
9.00 IST: Australia are bossing the game at the moment after bundling out India cheaply yesterday, and now have swelled their lead to 298. Captain Smith has registered his fifty and come this day, would look to add quick runs before handing the willow to the hosts. The pitch is going to deteriorate further and batting last on this wicket is never going to be easy. Can the Indians fightback or will Australia continue to strengthen their position in this Test? Let's see how the day unfolds. 
8.45 IST: Pune pitch under scanner as 24 wickets fall in two days BCCI Photo 
With 24 wickets falling in two days, the rank turner on offer at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune has led to questions being raised about the three curators in charge of preparing the pitch. 
Brief Day 2 Report: Left-arm spinner Steve O'Keefe picked up a career-best six for 35 to help Australia take command of the first Test against India after 15 wickets fell on a bowler-dominated second day of the contest on Friday. 
Playing only his fifth Test and first in India, O'Keefe took all his wickets in the space of 24 deliveries, including three in an over, to trigger a spectacular collapse and help Australia bundle out India for 105 in their first innings. 
Australia took a first innings lead of 155, a significant advantage on a spin-friendly track at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, which is making its debut as a Test centre. 
The touring side, who have lost their last nine Tests in Asia and were considered underdogs before the start of the four-match series, reached 143 for four at stumps in their second innings, an overall lead of 298 runs.
